data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word أَنْ comes from the root ا ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word وَكَانَ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
The word فَأُولَئِكَ comes from the root ا و ل ا and is associated with the meanings:
The word عَنْهُمْ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.
data.sentence: The word غَفُورًا comes from the root غ ف ر and is associated with the meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.

data.meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
data.sentence: The word عَفُوًّا comes from the root ع ف و and is associated with the meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
